intro: Impatiens bagshawei, commonly known as the Chinese impatiens, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, while its stems are slender and branching. Impatiens bagshawei thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for garden planting.
